snippet: A senior Chinese diplomat visited Tokyo this week to hold talks aimed at defusing tensions between Japan and China over a group of disputed islands, a Japanese official said Friday.
abstract: Senior Chinese diplomat visits Tokyo to hold talks aimed at defusing tensions between Japan and China over group of disputed islands in East China Sea; talks  show an apparent willingness by the nations to at least begin discussing their often highly emotional disagreement over control of the island group.

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno and Makiko Inoue contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A senior Chinese diplomat visited Tokyo this week to hold talks aimed at defusing tensions between Japan and China over a group of disputed islands, a Japanese official said Friday.

headline.seo: China and Japan Say They Held Talks Over Islands Dispute
headline.main: China and Japan Say They Held Talks About Island Dispute That Has Frayed Relations
headline.print_headline: China and Japan Say They Held Talks About Island Dispute That Has Frayed Relations
